title: @Meddler: Can we get a sneak peek of what to expect in Mid Season?
body:
So, as you mentioned in another post, you guys are already focusing on the Mid Season Update (one of my favorite ones, right behind ChampUps).

Can we get a general idea of what to expect?

replies.body: Right now the only stuff we're sure enough about to mention are some tank updates and associated defensive item work. We'll be looking into some other stuff too, details on that are still being figured out though.

Anyone locked down as a high priority for the tank update yet?

Also, what's going to happen to Poppy?  Yes I know she's had a big rework but she's got issues as well.

EDIT: what about support tanks?  They seem like they'll have more problems getting right than ones with a real income.  Are they going to be worked on separately.
We've got the tanks getting larger updates identified and underway. Should be talking about those later in the month.
Will the vanguard update affect maokai? I remember him being mentioned in the champion update new but isn't maokai supposed to be a warden?
How accurate is your [Subclass List](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/developer-corner/3A5uuBw7-champion-subclass-list) still?
Is it reasonable to expect the Kayle / Morgana dual update this year? Can we get an ETA?

I don't believe we'll be working on Morg or Kayle this year in terms of significant updates. As far as a dual update goes it's a really cool idea we've speculated about, but not something we've committed to.

Im not sure if that includes lore reworks but I had this idea based off of Morgana's and Kayles current Lore that of Kayle being a supposed oppressive Tyrant and Morgana being a freedom fighter/rebel out to stop her.

> Kayle is an angelic seraph meant to arbiter over mortals along side her sister Morgana who has gone insane from the years of bloodshed and war she's had to overseer.Thus Kayle decides to go on a mortal genocide crusade "Judging" (SEE:slaughtering) all the "sinful and unworthy" then ruling over whats left.
> 
> Kayle ask her sister Morgana to join  her but when Morgana declines seeking to maintain thier neutral roles (and therefor keep balance) They end up clashing and Kayle ultimately ends up burning off Morganas wings (a large source of their power and immortality) turning Morgana into the sympathetic anti-hero out to stop her tyrant sister. Since Morgana no longer has her wings she instead has learned to use her negative emotions as a battery for magic instead. 
> 
> Then if you wanna make things REALLY interesting you could have {{champion:266}}  be a manifestation of her madness or something. Her dark reflection and a literal shadow of war and bloodshed. 


Anyways I just think if you guys DO choose to update Kayle and Morg you should expand upon why Morgana and Kayle dislike each other so much and reflect that in their ingame VA (currently they basically have ZERO lines directed at each other ingame).
urgot and eve are after galio ( upcoming rework.) So they are probably pretty far down the list, might not make it into this year.
Thanks bud. Our communities seemed to think January, or early next year. (Just looking at the trends.) Of course the only rework we're looking forward to is visual, but it's good to stay in the loop.

> [{quoted}](name=Meddler,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=YZuKclGq,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2017-02-05T03:57:55.063+0000)
>
> Right now the only stuff we're sure enough about to mention are some tank updates and associated defensive item work. We'll be looking into some other stuff too, details on that are still being figured out though.

Do you think that Singed could show up in the minor changes ? I would really would like to see some small tweaks to him and his kit , like his W receive a grounded effect
Not sure who we'll be doing minor changes on yet. Possible we don't do much in the way of minor kit changes at all and instead put more time into wider base stat and item changes.

I think the Vanguard update should be more about items and systems than champions. Out of all the Vanguards I see 3 who I think need major changes, Amumu, Malphite and Rammus, Rek'sai arguably does too, but she's another case entirely since changes should be aimed at getting her out of the class. Other than that the majority of Vanguards are fairly solid and at most need minor changes to one spell.

I think your time would be best spent doing a small number of larger scale reworks and a large number of item and system reworks.

Could this be the time to finally get some gameplay improvements for Nasus (the supposedly *archetypal* Juggernaut who...uh, was completely ignored in the Jugg update and since)? Perhaps some early-game improvements to deal with the enhanced snowballing you seem intent on shoving down our throats? Actual, _meaningful_ lategame strengths that aren't "the Q he'll never get to hit squishies with does a lot of damage to squishies"?

Is there any chance of looking at Black Cleaver while defensive items are being updated? I feel like it's the case that armour items have to be tuned around the fact that Black Cleaver is in almost every game because it's good on such a huge variety of champions (pretty much anyone AD who's not an ADC buys it at least sometimes, and even some ADCs have started buying it). I feel like we'd get a more satisfying set of defensive itemisation options if Cleaver were at the very least more niche, even if it does still have its ridiculous armour-crunching power as something for people to opt into against super tanky comps.

> [{quoted}](name=Meddler,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=YZuKclGq,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2017-02-05T03:57:55.063+0000)
>
> Right now the only stuff we're sure enough about to mention are some tank updates and associated defensive item work. We'll be looking into some other stuff too, details on that are still being figured out though.

I think you guys should address Gnar, a lot of people are looking for Gnar to become meta again, and the Gnar Mains community as a whole are just looking for an answer from someone and whether or not he will be looked at in the vanguard update.

Source: http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/vwkVyHAx-meddler-is-gnar-going-to-be-looked-at-in-the-vanguard-update?

Would you consider adding a passive like Dawngate's old Ablative Armor that gave you stacks that partially block basic attacks' damage? It would reinforce the sustained damage role of Marksmen as they couldn't burst Tanks while they still have stacks up.

Will the defensive item rework potentially answer the 'rush a defense item (Seeker's/Hexdrinker/Negatron) in mid lane, proceed to stall the lane out because there's no effective way to beat it without a jungler? The lane is super polarized around defensive rushers vs non-rushers to the point the most practical way to engage is "shove the lane, roam because nothing will happen".

Some time ago brought up and somewhat supported for defensive stats to function the same way as regeneration stats do: you would have a base armor, mr and hp and then all items would add a percentage to that. Is that at all a consideration or has the idea bin scrapped?

Tanks need to be tankier than divers and juggernauts who use the same items. In the early true tanks tend to be squisher than fighters and juggernauts and show about the same level of durability in the mid game. It's only late that true tanks are more durable and late game defense is out scale by offense
